**The Vestment of Hell** is one of the [quest artifacts](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact") for the [Noble](/wiki/Noble "Noble") in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), it is the quest artifact specifically for [vampiric](/wiki/Vampire_\(starting_race\) "Vampire (starting race)") Nobles. [Human](/wiki/Human "Human") and [incantifier](/wiki/Incantifier_\(starting_race\) "Incantifier (starting race)") Nobles share the same [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") design but seek [the Mantle of Heaven](/wiki/The_Mantle_of_Heaven "The Mantle of Heaven") as their goal instead.

[Elven](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)"), [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\)#dNethack "Drow (starting race)") and [dwarven](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)") Nobles have different, race-specific quests and quest artifacts (see the [Noble](/wiki/Noble "Noble") main article for more details).

The Vestment is [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic") for [wishing](/wiki/Wishing "Wishing") and [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") purposes.

## dNetHack

In dNetHack the Vestment is an artifact [opera cloak](/wiki/Opera_cloak "Opera cloak") which grants [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance") when carried, and [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance") and [half physical damage](/wiki/Half_physical_damage "Half physical damage") when worn, *in addition to* whatever benefit is provided by the [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak") with the "opera cloak" [randomized appearance](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") in the game: [displacement](/wiki/Cloak_of_displacement "Cloak of displacement"), [invisibility](/wiki/Cloak_of_invisibility "Cloak of invisibility"), [magic resistance](/wiki/Cloak_of_magic_resistance "Cloak of magic resistance"), [protection](/wiki/Cloak_of_protection "Cloak of protection"). Also, its [armor class](/wiki/Armor_class "Armor class") is double that of its base item.

Wearing the Vestment also allows the Noble to #sit in the special [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne") in the [ancestral keep](/wiki/Noble_quest#Home_level "Noble quest") for a number of perks, including a free [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish"), a [genocide](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide"), some random [pets](/wiki/Pet "Pet") and an [identification](/wiki/Identification "Identification").

In vanilla NetHack, the "opera cloak" random appearance has a magenta tile (\[). The Noble patch changes the color of this tile to black (\[).

### Strategy

As the Vestment has a randomized cloak as its base item, its usefulness may vary between games. While there are no cloaks with randomized appearances in dNetHack that are a liability to their wearer, some cloak types may be especially useful combined with the other extrinsics of the Vestment. If its base item is a [cloak of protection](/wiki/Cloak_of_protection "Cloak of protection"), then the Vestment adds a formidable six points to your AC, *not counting enchantment*, plus maximum [magic cancellation](/wiki/Magic_cancellation "Magic cancellation"), eliminating the need for [Victorian underwear](/wiki/Shirt#Noble_Role "Shirt"). Other base cloaks offer only two points of default AC and MC2, but [displacement](/wiki/Displacement "Displacement"), [invisibility](/wiki/Invisibility "Invisibility"), or [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") may still be desirable extrinsics in addition to the default fire and acid resistance, and half physical damage.

The Vestment's acid resistance by itself is quite nice, as there are few other items that confer it—notably the [alchemy smock](/wiki/Alchemy_smock "Alchemy smock"), which the Vestment can easily replace. (In this respect the Vestment may have an advantage over its non-vampiric counterpart, the [Mantle of Heaven](/wiki/Mantle_of_Heaven "Mantle of Heaven").) The Vestment can also replace the much heavier dNetHack-specific [Leo nemaeus hide](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/Items#Leo_nemaeus_hide "User:Chris/dNetHack/Items") as a source of the half physical damage intrinsic.

The [Rod of Lordly Might](/wiki/Rod_of_Lordly_Might "Rod of Lordly Might") (scepter/first [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift")), the Vestment of Hell (robe/quest artifact), and the [Helm of the Dark Lord](/wiki/DNetHack_Artifacts#The_Helm_of_the_Dark_Lord "DNetHack Artifacts") (coronet/[crowning](/wiki/Crowning "Crowning") gift) complete the Vampiric Noble's regalia.

## References

Reference: [Chris's Noble Patch](https://github.com/Chris-plus-alphanumericgibberish/dnethack/commit/980737c5e4fca9299af8f797d159182f7c2bc242)
